website_summaries.verdict: Lenovo's AR helmet for phones feels like a clever mini-HoloLens for Star Wars fans, but as a standalone headset with no other software, it's a tough sell.
pros: The self-contained headset is wireless and generates some decent holographic effects
Will run on even some older iPhones and Android phones
A good handful of challenges and game modes
Comes with its own lightsaber hilt
cons: Doesn't always track your movements or the lightsaber very well
Lightsaber sometimes drops up out of sync
Inserting and setting up the phone isn't easy or quick
Who knows if this will ever run other games?

customer_reviews.title: Recommended - Winner
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift and got a chance to play a few rounds with it - the setup takes a bit of effort (so don't lose the instructions) but the actual game play is FUN FUN FUN. It was great watching each other take turns and everyone had a great experience. I like that you are not completely immersed and it's a mix of reality with augmented reality so you can still interact with people "outside" of the game. May get one myself.
customer_reviews.author: norm

customer_reviews.title: Junk
customer_reviews.text: I guess I wasn't sure what to expect for the money. It sure wasn't what I got. Bought this for my 7yo son for Christmas. Despite using an approved phone/device, we had nothing but errors. This requires to constant removal of the phone from the VR headset to clear the error. Just not worth the cost or the hassle. Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Ian Parsons

customer_reviews.title: Neat novelty item, works ok!
customer_reviews.text: I got on a big sale, I would not pay anywhere near full MSRP for this. I had kept my eye on them since release, and finally, at $50 I had to pull the trigger. Games are ok, a little confusing but the novelty factor is fun. I purchased knowing this, and planned on putting the light saber on a display shelf once I was bored with the game, as it looks very nice. Decent item, novelty wears off quickly, the light saber is a good display prop!
customer_reviews.author: Theta Chi Clayton HB

customer_reviews.title: Fun, but expensive.
customer_reviews.text: Very entertaining. Our kids have enjoyed it. Our two biggest complaints are as follows. 1 - Not compatible with all smart phones. Since our kids were going to be using this, we just upgraded & was hoping to use one of our older smart phones. We were not able to do so. So, when our kids want to use this, they have to use one of our smart phones. We don’t mind, but it also limits when they are able to play with it. 2- Price.
customer_reviews.author: CS

customer_reviews.title: Cheap fun, that I hope continues to get better
customer_reviews.text: Set up can be a bit of a pain. Drains my Pixel 2 battery pretty quickly (which isn't unexpected). The visual space can be a little awkward and the responsiveness has some latency and glitchiness issues. That said I have a couple and love them as first generation toys. Given it's app based, they system should upgrade easily with increasing quality of phones, efficiency of batteries, 5G, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: wow, last product I will ever buy from Lenovo
customer_reviews.text: I can't believe they would take this to market. It's glitchy. It's frustrating. The opposite of enjoyable. You'ed be better of saving your money and getting an oculus rift. Or waiting for apples vr
customer_reviews.author: Holden Delak

customer_reviews.title: Super fun
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my boyfriend as a Christmas gift. It was easy to get setup and started, after charging up the batteries over night. It's a ton of fun, just make sure you have enough room to set up the tracking beam and put away any roaming cats/dogs. Cat Tod was accidentally gently kicked. The game is fun and you can loose yourself in the battles so you forget about your surroundings (again make sure you have space). I had to look up some forums about the game to learn how to use some of the special moves.
customer_reviews.author: Kimberly Gauer

customer_reviews.title: ITS A STAR WARS LIGHTSABER BATTLING GAME, WHAT MORE DO  YOU NEED?!
customer_reviews.text: this is not only a fun game but it is a workout. and you will need at least a 10 ft circle around you to play. the vr is really pretty cool, it looks just like the holograms in the star wars movies. the attention to detail in the graphics is really great. you have to have a good smartphone to play and wifi. i love this game.
customer_reviews.author: HJbunger

customer_reviews.title: Headset is too heavy!
customer_reviews.text: The AR, graphics, game play is incredible! I love this thing, problem is, the headset is so incredibly heavy that it physically weighs down my head/neck and makes it too sufferable to play for any duration of time. I am in my 30s, I have a PlayStation VR, zero problems. This is really uncomfortable and would definitely not recommend for children cause of the weight :(
customer_reviews.author: Madelyn Barber

customer_reviews.title: You well need about 6' diameter of clear space
customer_reviews.text: Ok so the bad...it loads a little slow, makes the phone run hot. The good... Completely immersive. You cansee objects in the room so yippy don't run into them, the holographic quality is awesome. In heavy battle,I've had to recenter a few times.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff D.

customer_reviews.title: Cool concept
customer_reviews.text: This is a very cool concept, but it didn’t work for us. The first one we bought was broken (the light saber wouldn’t connect). The replacement they sent actually connected, but it was extremely glitchy. We ended up returning this and received a refund. For reference, our Samsung Galaxy S8 never worked. Our iPhone 6S worked, but it was glitchy.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: Very fun but need to work out some kinks
customer_reviews.text: The game is amazing and lightsaber controler is a nerd dream come true. There seems to be some bugs in tracking the movement of the blade. My blade often suddenly bends at strange angle. I may just need to play around with where I'm placing my beacon.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick J. Sullivan

customer_reviews.title: You can finally live out your Star Wars fantasy!
customer_reviews.text: Okay, so I saw this at CES in Las Vegas and there was a line of people trying to get to the demo; I didn't have time so I decided to get one for myself...and WOW! this thing is out of this world. I have only had it for a day but after the setup (read the instructions) it worked and my lightsaber was ready and paired. I started playing on the first planet and it really feels like you are dueling a stars wars character. My hear was racing when they started to attack me (it's a bit of a workout). Highly recommended for all folks that grew up with Star Wars or are into cool tech...cheers!
customer_reviews.author: Lonely Aardvark

customer_reviews.title: Really really cool!
customer_reviews.text: This is so freaking cool. Love being able to see the room when fighting droids and other characters from the series. It is entertaining to watch others play as well. Would be cool if you didn't need to use your phone but still is well worth it! Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: co

customer_reviews.title: wonderful without comfortable set up
customer_reviews.text: funtion great but install not easy with smartphone. Note9 sise can not put in this goggle. small phone need it. also app setup with goggle is not comfortable every each play. very annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Why light saber cannot stay connected
customer_reviews.text: So excited to recieve this but cannot connect the light saber. It only connects for 5 seconds and turns white again. I need help!! Kind of a bummer I'm looking for help because I have hope and want to friggin have a light saber battle already!! HELP!
customer_reviews.author: James Pinzel

customer_reviews.title: More than expected
customer_reviews.text: Purchased as a gift for 13 year old boy. He loves it. Very versatile. The app is easy to use and such a to the lightsaber well. The tutorials included with app easy to understand. The response time is slightly slow as compared to real life or other video games, so it’s frustrating for my 9 year old. But a solid “toy” for that growing up stage between kids toys and grown up gifts. Holochess is easy to learn and fun to play for all ages. Harder levels and app updates are expected!
customer_reviews.author: jd

customer_reviews.title: Awesome experience
customer_reviews.text: It was amazing, you could swing like a Jedi and the graphics were good, you could even use this to exercise, it worked with my iPhone 11 and it was really fun The blade calibration should improve because during mid-battle, I had to calibrate it, I also hope the setup will be easier
customer_reviews.author: Lopuytr4r

customer_reviews.title: 100% Fun
customer_reviews.text: This game is awesome. It is immersive and just plain cool. I took it to work and my entire team played it and loved it. We are thinking of chipping in and getting one for the office so we can play it regularly. I also loved the packaging it came in. I’ve always loved unboxing new electronics and this was crisp and enjoyable to unpack. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: b balyko

customer_reviews.title: Not Up To Date for an S10
customer_reviews.text: Not compatible for an S10. My husband got it for Christmas and hasn't gotten to use it. We spent hours setting it up, after all that effort only to realize it isn't compatible with an S10 phone. Very frustrating

customer_reviews.title: Really fun plan to get more

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with listed phones
customer_reviews.text: The headset is not compatible with all of the phones it lists as being so. Very frustrating experience on Christmas morning. My IPhone 8 will not connect after 3 hours of trying every troubleshooting method. After reading some forums, this seems to be a trend.

customer_reviews.title: Too expensive.
customer_reviews.text: Great game but too expensive for what it's real is.

customer_reviews.title: So cool! Maybe optimal in a dark room.

customer_reviews.text: You need a huge space to get the most out of it. Plus you can beat all the lightsaber battles just by “jabbing” at your virtual opponent with the lightsaber.

customer_reviews.title: A MUST for your Star Wars fan
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 sons (13 & 9) and they couldn't get enough of this! And it created quite a stir with the neighbors too! Truly an amazing interactive immersive experience! My younger son loves all things Jedi and Lightsabers and this is the best birthday present I could have gotten for him. I've tried it too - very fun!

customer_reviews.title: So much fun

If you are using for a party (like I did). Make sure you fully charge it pre-party and set up your phone to work with it. I started a few minutes before my party started, big mistake!

customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a birthday gift for my guy. He said it is the best birthday gift ever. It’s a great party game, fun to play and fun to watch others play.

customer_reviews.title: this game is still fun to play
customer_reviews.text: Even if you aren't a Star Wars fan, this game is still fun to play. Setup takes a little bit of time, but it's simple and steps are easy to follow. Dual battling is my favorite. I feel like I am actually fighting Darth Maul since the game is so immersive. Since the game is augmented reality I can still see my normal surroundings, which definitely eliminates any motion sickness you could get from a VR game. I hope there will be more games to play in the future. This one is definitely a hit.

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy, not a finished product
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my grandkids. The software is very poor, even after almost 2 months after being released, no way to close the program, I have had to shut off my phone to get out of the app. Also no profiles, so only way to have others do the tutorial is to remove the software and reinstall it,.. or have multiple phones for each of the grandkids to play their own game and progression. Graphics are grainy and poor, definitely not good quality. I have used an iPhone X and an iPhone 6 to try out this product. Not worth $200.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Worthen

product_meta.title: Lenovo Star Wars: Jedi Challenges, Smartphone Powered Augmented Reality Experience
product_meta.description:
Star Wars: Jedi Challenges brings Star Wars into your world with the technology of augmented reality. Train as a force-sensitive apprentice and unlock the knowledge of the Jedi order. Learn to master the art of lightsaber duels, command troops against invading evil forces, and challenge your mind with Holochess. Awaken your inner Jedi.

Lightsaber Battles
- Perfect your lightsaber skills by taking on some of the most menacing villains the dark side has to offer.
- Defeat waves of enemy troops across all eras in Assault Mode.
- Face off in 1-on-1 duels against Kylo Ren, Darth Vader and more.
- Progress through varying levels of difficulty across six planets.
- Use Force powers to strategically defeat your enemies.

Holochess 
-Train your mind in the ultimate game of concentration and strategy, as first seen in Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope.
- Direct holographic alien pieces as you battle for territory on checkered game tables.
- Collect eight unique creatures, each with different strengths and weaknesses.
- Outsmart your opponent with tactical skill and a powerful team.

Strategic Combat 
- Test your skills as a military strategist and command armies against enemy troops in large-scale ground wars.
- Place your defenses and units to strategically defeat enemies on the battlefield.
- Lead heroes such as Luke Skywalker and Obi-Wan Kenobi to overcome the forces of the dark side.
- Recreate epic battles from the Star Wars saga like the Battle of Hoth.
- Unlock new units and troops as you progress through increasingly difficult challenges.

Lightsaber Versus Mode
- Engage other players in intense 1-on-1 local multiplayer battles in the new Lightsaber Versus Mode to see who will become the ultimate lightsaber duelist. 
-Now available through a free update to the Star Wars: Jedi Challenges app. 
- Battle against your friends with dynamic lightsaber duels that are different every time.
- Use the Force to sense your opponent’s next move and counter their attacks!
- Skill matters as you block, dodge and strike your adversary to claim victory in epic lightsaber combat.
*To access Lightsaber Versus Mode, both players must each have a separate Star Wars: Jedi Challenges starter kit and the latest version of the mobile app downloaded on a compatible smartphone. Players must be in the same space approximately 6 feet apart.

Game Gear
- Lightsaber Controller: Experience what it feels like to wield a lightsaber for the first time – to face off against enemies right in your own living room. Feel your opponents' attacks with force feedback.
- Lenovo Mirage AR Headset: The Lenovo Mirage AR headset is ergonomically designed for maximum game immersion.
- Tracking Beacon: The beacon ensures accurate tracking of your location, while expanding and filling in the environment around you with an immersive augmented reality universe, Lightning to micro-USB cable, USB-C to micro-USB cable.
feature_bullets: AUGMENTED REALITY: Awaken your inner Jedi with Star Wars: Jedi Challenges, a smartphone powered augmented reality experience that brings an all-new Star Wars experience right into your home. Simply start the app, put on the headset, and begin your journey. Immerse yourself in three epic experiences: Lightsaber Battles, Holochess, and Strategic Combat

LIGHTSABER BATTLES: Perfect your lightsaber skills by taking on some of the most menacing villains the dark side has to offer. Engage other players in intense 1-on-1 local multiplayer battles in the new Lightsaber Versus Mode
HOLOCHESS: Train your mind in the ultimate game of concentration and strategy, as first seen in Star Wars: Episode IV – A New Hope
STRATEGIC COMBAT:  Test your skills as a military strategist and command armies against enemy troops in large-scale ground wars

PHONE COMPATIBILITY: Star Wars: Jedi Challenges is a smartphone-powered experience compatible with select Android and iOS devices. Currently Validated Phones: iPhone XS, iPhone X, iPhone 8 Plus, iPhone 8, iPhone 7 Plus, iPhone 7, iPhone 6s Plus, iPhone 6s, iPhone 6 Plus, iPhone 6. Samsung Galaxy S9, S8, Samsung Galaxy S7 edge, Samsung Galaxy S7, Google Pixel XL, Google Pixel, Moto Z2 Force, Moto Z, LG G6. Mate 10, Mate 10 Pro, Nova 2S, Xiaomi MIX2, Sony Xperia XZ1
